device_models: Microsoft PixelSense, Lenovo X100 laptop; HP ELitpads; iPhone
devices_included: Tablet; Phone; Laptop; Tabletop, large horizontal display
contribution_desc:
The core concepts of configuration work, activity configuration, and configuration space are introduced. 

ActivitySpace is an implementation of the configuration space concept. It is a distributed activity-centried information management system. Active work setup across all connected devices (e.g. laptop, tablet, smartphone) is visualized on a tabletop display. Through multi-touch gestures, the setup can be reconfigured and data can be transferred between devices. 

Through a scenario-base user evaluation, the perceived usefulness as well as usage of ActivitySpace for cross-device tasks was evaluated.
tracking_characteristic: Outside-in tracking; Location 2D; Tracking devices only
crossdevice_def: "... a device ecology in which each device acts as a specialized portal into users' personal or shared information space. The user-device mapping is quickly changing from being a one-to-one to a one-to-many or even to a many-to-many relation."
